richard.layne@ntlworld.com

Talking of US distribution of P&P films, today's

Guardian has an obituary for Max Rosenberg -

http://film.guardian.co.uk/news/story/0,12589,1244258,00.html

Max Rosenberg

American horror film producer with a suave English style

The son of a furrier, Rosenberg graduated from New York City College and St John Law School. He first worked as a lawyer, and then in film distribution, before going into partnership with showman Joe Levine in 1945 to import art-house films into America. They distributed the 1959 remake of The Blue Angel; Man Of Aran, the 1934 classic documentary of Irish fishermen; Roberto Rossellini's story of the Italian resistance, Open City (1945); and several Michael Powell pictures, including The Edge Of The World (1937), about an isolated Shetland community.

Richard

The Times got there on Monday, with a many-times-longer obit (assuming

that the above is the complete obit), but nevertheless managing not to

mention Michael Powell; it concentrated on Rosenberg's long producing

career in the UK.

Incidentally, my grandfather was called Max Rosenberg - but no relation.
